intro: Capsella praematura, commonly known as the early peppergrass, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20 to 50 centimeters and has alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by dry, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
